text.p: These are the leading stories in the Zimbabwe press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The weekly independent Financial Gazette, normally published on Thursday, will be published on Friday after a working week shortened by Heroes' and Defence Forces' public holidays on Monday and Tuesday.
- One of Zimbabwe's leading milling companies, National Foods, has failed to dispose some "excess" maize mills because there is overcapacity in the country and around the southern African region.
- A price haggle in the proposed acquisition of local Bard Discount House by the Discount Company of Zimbabwe has indefinitely put off negotiations between the two firms.

- About 100 Zimbabwe war veterans protesting the suspension of pension commutation payments on Wednesday ransacked the ruling ZANU-PF national headquarters in Harare, cutting telephone lines, looting food and cigarettes and holding some party employees in temporary hostage.

- Zimbabwe police reported that some 23 people were killed and 323 others injured in road accidents around the country during a weekend Heroes' and Defence Forces' public holiday that ended on Tuesday.
